description: After deliberation, Rada Miskovic chooses to report positively on the Council’s new citywide calibration campaign, emphasizing messages of restored order and stability in her state media segments.
Rada’s coverage frames the calibration drive as a return to normalcy, encouraging public trust and routine engagement with rejuvenated BCI services in several districts.

The Council officially launches the 'Citywide Calibration' initiative, rolling out daily compliance prompts and reminders across digital and transit interfaces, tied to previously established BCI routines.
Residents in former pilot zones detect subtle system references to Halden’s controversial updates hidden in routine prompts. Rumors surface, warning of concealed mechanisms for social control.

Neighborhoods fracture in response: some embrace the smoother access, others publicly accuse the Council of manipulation, igniting fierce debates, local sabotage, and secret gatherings to decode the prompts.
